Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chaterinecat
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel with excelent view. My room, the 36, had 2 big windows, both of them viewing the canaletto.original venetian style.loved the breakfast! I enjoyed the hospitality and familiarity of the receptionist, he made me a very good impression. I would love to return!!! I highly reccomend this hotel to anyone who enjoyes the authentic venetian style!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: christy007_12
Reviews.Content: This is a great value for Venice. The hotel is sandwiched in between 5 stars hotels and is a third of the price. We stayed here last week and loved it. Our room was clean and over the canal. I will stay there again!!! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Rasmanrulz
Reviews.Content: I'm really glad that we picked this hotel. Yeah the rooms are small but the location and view was terrific. We stayed during the summer heatwave and the room was quite hot at times but not too bad. This was our third time in Venice but the first time we'd had a canal view. It was great to look out the window in the morning and see the gondoliers!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Nils06Oslo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lisbona i July, and can hightly recommend this hotel. Good location, very nice staff and a tasting breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny & HOT rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tcoleman3
Reviews.Content: The rooms really are tiny. They have a way of turning off the A/C at night so you get to wake up during the night sweltering. They will turn it back on if you walk down three flights of stairs and ask tho. You have to keep asking too.

Reviews.Title: “They charged me twice!! :-(((”
Reviews.Author: AnaTosca
Reviews.Content: The receptionist on our check-out said my visa couldn't go through (??) and I paid in cash. When I got my first Visa statement upon our return to home, I saw the same charge did went through! :-(( A dispute file has been opened with the bank, and waiting... 3 months now... it looks I won't get my money back... :-((( Otherwise, not bad hotel, for that price... :-((

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you don't mind a tiny room”
Reviews.Author: mariasyd
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a cute Venetian feel, the location was very central, only a few minutes away from St Marks and we could walk to most places. When we arrived, the man that the front desk offered to take my bag, i declined, walked around the corner and changed my mind. We had to carry our bags up a long steep flight of stairs! Our room was tiny, bed was squashed against one wall and we didn't have room to open our bags. I was ok with this but my boyfriend struggled with the claustrophic feel. The room was very clean and bathroom looked renovated. We peaked into another room and saw that it was of a reasonable size, i'd suggest that you upgrade if you want some space. Overall i like this place, location was great for the price and was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old hotel, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: Nickademus64
Reviews.Content: The Lisbona is a lovely hotel, the room we had was a little cramped but nonetheless very comfortable. The location was perfect, being close to the Piazza San Marco, transport was easy. The hotel provided good service and the staff were very helpful

Reviews.Title: “The tinniest room IÂ´ve ever saw in my life”
Reviews.Author: alesilva
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a a very good spot, near Piazza San Marco, but if you have claustrophobia, youÂ´ll probably feel a little uncomfortable, because the the bedroom is very, very small. But if your budget is low and youÂ´re not looking for an amazing view of a canal with a gondolier singing under your window, this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location.. but that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: SAinCR
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small hotel at reasonable prices (very hard to find in Venice) with AMAZING LOCATION, Hotel LIsbona is your place. This hotel is located just around the corner from the San Marco Water Taxi Stop. So easy to get too. From Santa Lucia Train Station, hop on the Water Taxi (#1 or #41) and go to San Marco, get off, walk a few short blocks and you are there. The hotel website has great and easy walking directions on their website. They provided a free breakfast but it was barely adequate and served in a very small room that doubled as their sitting room during the day. Having said that their server who cleaned tables in between guests did a great job of keeping the tables moving and clean and serving a coffee and tea very quickly. The rest was buffet. Basic continental though the items were often on the stale side and the fruits very limited. On our check out day we had to leave before breakfast began (by about 1/2 hr) and asked if we could get coffee to go (something other hotels in Italy did for us) but this hotel did not accommodate that request. If it's location you want you'll get it but don't expect friendly cheery front desk folks because you won't find it here. The front desk people (except Chris who was very friendly) are sullen and non-accommodating. They will help you if you ask but you're left feeling like you bothered them unnecessarily. Smiles are also not given freely if at all. It could be a cultural thing in Venice?? The hotel has 3 floors and we were on the very top floor. We had to walk 59 steps to our room and 59 steps down each time we left. It's good if you want a cardio workout and don't mind carrying your stuff up and down these steps. The room was frankly horrible. It was small barely larger than a double bed. It had a double bed, a window (with a view of the building next door even though their website says every room has canal view) and the TV was a 12 inch TV propped on top of a 6-8 foot wardrobe crammed in front of the bed. If you have claustrophobia, don't pick this hotel as despite it's great location, you are likely not to enjoy it. The hotel entrance and lobby are very quaint. Right outside the doors of the hotel is gondola rides and lobby has lots of charming antiques.. but the carpeting is very old, the hotel beyond the lobby is shabby and our room was stanky.. dusty (we had to dust our own headboard) and very very small. Having said all this, we still enjoyed our stay in Venice and loved the location of this hotel and since we spent very little time in our hotel room we were able to take deep cleansing breathes at nite to avoid a panic attack before falling off into an exhausted tourist induced sleep. PS no internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Don`t stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olav_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the beginning of august, when it was hot. The aircondition was very bad, we could not sleep there. The room was very small and it had a smell of old smoke. Therefor we decided to leave the hotel after a few ours. We offer to pay for one night, but had to pay for the hole stay (3 nights) !!! We left and will never come back. The hotel has a good location, but this didn`t help us. Olav from Norway

Reviews.Title: “Low level three star experience”
Reviews.Author: Olderguy
Reviews.Content: The location is fine - in easy reach of San Marco etc. The hotel itself seems to be limited by its structure / history. No lift, so a long walk up stairs. Small rooms - I thought ours was small until I saw the pics of some others! At least we could get up both sides of the double bed! Our ' bathroom' would have made a good size wardrobe - perhaps it had been! - but it did have modern fittings and plenty of hot water etc. Air con was fine. Breakfast limited but adequate. Breakfast room small and had to wait most mornings for a table to become free. Staff were pleasant and helpful and everything as very clean. Not the best three star I have stayed in in Europe but all the basics were there and at the price it represented good value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great location, rooms VERY small and pricey.”
Reviews.Author: MAkutner
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is just a great spot for being able to wander around the main touristy part of Venice. The staff is friendly and polite; the day-time manager speaks excellent English, but you'll need a translation guide for the evening staff. They were helpful in providing maps and suggestions about where to go, and they let us store our luggage there after we checked out so we could sightsee a little more. The room is small, not just a little small, but so small you won't want to even be in the room unless you're sleeping, or brushing your teeth, which you pretty much do 5 feet away. The internet was so slow I actually had to pay for a second hour of time to check emails. The breakfast was adequate, with rolls, cereal and fruit. All in all, a nice clean hotel with a great location. But at 149 euros it was a little more than what we expected to pay for the kind of amenities provided.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Sandy-Ross
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise. When we opened the window, we looked out over a canal of Gondolas, leading straight out to the Grand Canal. A real treat listening to the Gondoliers each morning setting up for the day. The room itself was redolent of a 16th century palazzo, with the plush walls and period decor. Breakfast was excellent as was the service. The only downfall was there is no lift. A couple of blocks to Piazza San Marco and the centre of the historic city. Shops and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: Manders960
Reviews.Content: Very good service and very close to piazza san marco

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: anna_vish_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a friend in August for 2 nights. This hotel is steps away from Piazza San Marco (literally) and right on a canal. We didn't get a canal-room view, because it was more expensive, we paid 90 eu/night for both of us. Location - as i mentioned already, absolutely amazing! Room - VERY small, however very clean. It's more like a walk-in closet with a tiny little bathroom attached to it, but we had no complaints as we didnt stay in, except to sleep. Service - the service was excellent here, they did us a favour and gave us breakfast at 5am in the morning! Food - mediocre, just a dry breakfast, but the hot beverages were great *Note: there is no elevator at this hotel and the stairs are VERY steep, so for anyone who has mobility issues this would not be the right place to stay. All in all, I'd definately go back, as the price and the location were great!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: kaetzchenMunich
Reviews.Content: My partner (German) and I (Italian) liked the hotel very much. Three stars well deserved, great location (on a canal near San Marco), kind staff, plus not at all expensive. We were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Ok location, faulty rooms, and non-responsive staff”
Reviews.Author: catire79
Reviews.Content: As usual we booked thru internet. Although I told them I was coming with wife and child they gave us a room with one queen bed, nothing else available. In addition, the A/C was not working properly in the room and the personnel on duty could do 'niente' about it. We were given a fan, and the promise of a discount in the morning. Next day we were charged in full, and the day attendant said the A/C "was just fine". So much the customer being always right. Breakfast is ok, and internet available at a price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lisbona: Great Location, but Skimpy Size”
Reviews.Author: HonestTraveller121
Reviews.Content: When my husband booked our trip to Italy, I told him that I had two criteria that had to be met in order to stay in a hotel: private bathroom and clean. Hotel Lisbona certainly meets these two criteria. Pros: Hotel Lisbona is very close to St. Mark's, Harry's Bar and a Vaporetto stop. The hotel clerk was very kind to my husband and me. He even carried our luggage up the three flights of stairs. Breakfast in the morning was more than adequate. It included a toast, rolls, croissants, cereals, juices, cheese, meats, and a pastry. Fresh cappuccino and tea were brought to our table by a kindly woman. The hotel offered/arranged a free water taxi ride over to a glass factory on the Island of Murano. There was no pressure to buy anything at this factory and we received a fun and informative tour of the glass factory. Our room did overlook the canal and at night it was fun to open the window and look at the gondolas passing by the room. There is a major gondola station from which you can commission a gondola ride right outside the hotel. Cons: Our room was VERY tiny. I believe that this goes for the rest of the rooms. If you are planning on carrying a lot of luggage, this is not the place for you to stay. The bathroom was tiny, as well. It only inlcudes a stand up shower, not a bathtub. The bed was not a true full or queen. Rather, it was two twin sized beds pushed together. Unfortunately, I rolled into the center gully on several occassions. This seemed to be a pretty common occurrence, though, in Italy. The mattress itself was fairly stiff and there were only two pillows, which were not very supportive. To be fair, we did not request additional pillows. The air conditioning worked moderately well. We stayed during a wave and the room was stuffy at times. Don't expect American standards of air conditioning; you will be disappointed. I was happy with my experience because I suspended my American understanding of hotels and recalibrated it to be in keeping with what is offered in Europe for this price level of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: krayner1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via GTA travel, and it wasn't cheap. We chose it for the location next to the venue for the wedding we were attending. With an 18-month-old and me heavily pregnant, convenience and some decent, comfortable accommodation was our top priority. WHAT A NIGHTMARE. Hotel Lisbona has the cheek to claim to be 3-stars. We booked a double room with cot and the information on the website we booked through promised a canal-view from all rooms. The room we got was a depressing shoe-box overlooking a service alley. Only 7 ft wide, with a 6 ft bed in it, it was a joke. I walked in and said where is the other half of the room?! You couldn't open the wardrobe for the table in front of it and the air-con (controlled by the penny-pinching manager down at the front desk) took approx 8 hours to bring the room to a reasonable temperature, meaning we spent 2 nights in a hot, poky hovel with very little natural light. The mini-bar didn't work, so no cool drinks either. The cot would not fit, so we ended up dismantling it (plus they wanted an unreasonable 20 euros per night for an old rickety travel cot - not mentioned when booking). There is no lift, and the 57 stairs to our room killed me. Breakfast was uninspiriing. Nothing fresh at all, not even a piece of fruit. However, the main problem with this hotel is the arrogant, rude hotel manager who saw our issues as our problem, not his, and who was quite prepared to have a stand-up argument with me, despite my condition. He should also appreciate that some foreigners can speak Italian so he should watch what he says. Rather than guests, you felt like an inconvenience from which he wished to extract as much cash as possible. His attitude towards us was very upsetting and totaly spoilt our stay. I can only recommend that people BOYCOTT THIS HOTEL so they might change their ways.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: thirtys0mething
Reviews.Content: spent our 10th anniversary there, it was very convenient for st marks square and all other attractions, hotel met all our expectations as although it was small it was very clean and the continental breakfast was good quality, as it is situated on a small but busy canal this would suit people wanting to be in the heart of the action but not those looking for a peacefull break. staff were friendly and professional and offered good advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but”
Reviews.Author: DAKDAK1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lisbona is nicely decorated and in a great location for walking around Venice. On checking in late the male receptionist seemed totally indifferent and our arrival appeared a bit of a chore for him. Whilst most rooms look out onto the canal, our room ( No 16 ) looked onto a side ally.It was unbelievably small and was clearly a single room being used as a double. The breakfast was excellent and the daytime male reception staff pleasant and courteous. I would probably stay here again,if only for the location but certainly not in room 16!!!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but it's all downhill from there!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brunette-traveller
Reviews.Content: Good location beside St Mark's Square & that's the only good thing I say about this hotel. With two people, two suitcases & a bed the room was full. The bathroom could loose the bidet & give a little extra space. You couldn't swing a mouse in it never mind a cat!!!! It felt we were a major inconvenice to the male receptionist when we were checking in!! All in all, in 3 simple words: DON'T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok base for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: gaspar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lisbona looked like a bargain when I found it on the internet. First time in Venice, so nothing to compare it to in the area. Location: Fantastic location, once you find it. The hotel is next to the Hotel Bauer (5 star) in San Marco. That should be easy, shouldn't it? well, there is no signs apart from a very dim lit "hotel lisbona" under a covered arch. It is not visible from the street. To find it: Coming from the vaporetto/P. San Marco, pass the hotel Bauer on the left, go over the canal and turn left passing the Gondolieri cabin. Yes, it is there, although you will not see it until you are under the arch. Check in: Nothing to talk about. Give the passports, get the key, upstairs to the left..... Found the room. Room: To put it in nice words, cosy. Room 22 (not the smallest) was 3.5m by 3.75m. Yes that's the bed and nothing more. Even the minibar was hanging from the wall. The TV, a 14" set was 3 mts high on top of the cupboard. Good selection of channels, with CNN and BBC world in english. The bathroom was.... well a one person affair. They have managed to include the loo, a bidet, basin and shower. So crammed that I barely fit. The shower is laughable. 55 cm wide by 60 cm deep. It must sound like I love measuring, but I did get a measuring tape as a joke. I could not believe it. You won't be able to wash your feet (the bidet comes in handy) The most striking feature of the hotel is the traditional feel to it. The walls are covered with venetian pattern fabrics and the chandeliers show the Murano style. Fantastic view from the window. With the gondola service just outside the hotel you can hear the gondolieri singing in the afternoon. Breakfast: Juice, tea/coffee, croissants, bread rolls, selection of cereals, cold meats, cheese, preserves and packaged toasts. Nothing warm. They don't have a kitchen. They don't even have a toaster. Not great but very convenient. Housekeeping: The hotel is kept clean. It boasts 3 stars, but for you and me this is a good B&B, probably a 4 diamond (without the breakfast). The only issue i had was when I first opened the minibar there was a glass that someone had used to drink a pill in the last few months and it had escaped the attention of the cleaner. I took it to reception. The guy there looked shocked and apologised. The glass never came back.

Reviews.Title: “4* at 2* price!!”
Reviews.Author: michaelanddeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Lisbona in November 2005.. I cannot fault it..!! We had 3 floor to ceiling opening windows with small balconies off our room.. The gondolas were beneath & it was a wonderful sight..The room itself wasn`t very big but it was ample for what we needed & decorated to a high standard.. The breakfast was great as was the receptioist who couldn`t help us enough.. Thoroughly enjoyable holiday & would definately recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you dont get room #25”
Reviews.Author: stelios1980
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel 6 months in advance for our honeymoon and requesting via email a canal view for our special occasion, we were extremeley dissapointed in the room which we were provided. The room just fit a queen size bed which is pushed up against the wall, while the other side is only about 30cm from the bed to the wall, and of course the only view we had was a brick wall that was 1 metre from our window. We had two suitcases that we had to pile on top of each other just to squeeze to get to the other side of the room. Like other reviews the bathroom is extremely small, i understand alot of hotels in venice have small rooms but we still reckon the room must of been an old storage room for all the cleaning products,mops,brooms etc. When i asked the concierge for a room change because of the size and because we had booked it 6 months in advance, he pretended to look through the reservation list and just bluntly replied, 'we are booked out'. Abit funny when throughout our stay we only bumped into 2-3 other couples. Just to warn you all, that when you are booking this hotel you make it very clear that you don't want room # 25, beleive me you will thank me for this review. Only positives on this hotel is that it is very easily found and the location of this hotel is great, very close to st marks square and the gondollas which is right outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location, good value”
Reviews.Author: PaulandDiane
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for six nights in June. Staff very welcoming and receptionist spoke English well. Breakfast was cold buffet with plenty of choice. Room small but adequate, although en suite was so small you could barely turn around to shut the door behind you. Also a high step into the bathroom. Our room was on the first floor with three sets of french doors overlooking the canal - excellent for watching the gondoliers prepare at the start of the day and we enjoyed watching the hustle and bustle of assorted water transport throughout the day. Quiet at night both inside and outside hotel. Very close (5 mins walk) to St Marks Square and all the designer shops - ideal location for walking round central Venice and all water transport too. Hotel tricky to find - make sure you have very detailed instructions. Overall would recommend this hotel as good value for money and central location. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel but dont forget to shut the windows!!”
Reviews.Author: cityplayer22
Reviews.Content: Great location. Room as to be expected in Venice was on the small side but spotlessly clean. The staff we met were really helpful. Breakfast good and plentiful. Another plus is the taxi from the airport will drop you off next to the hotel. But, the weather was very warm during our stay and we left the windows open - we were on the canal side of the hotel on the 2nd floor, the noise from the boats passing in the night was loud enough to wake us up!! Bear this in mind and you will have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: stefan1e
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are small but then look around you venice isn't exactly sprawling with space. IT was clean, the staff were exremely friendly the room had a beautiful view out onto the canal san moise and the gondolas stationed there. The noise from this station is not a problem with the windows shut you can hardly hear anything. the hotel was in an ideal location so close to st marks square adn the major attractions. You could not find a better centrally located hotel for the great price i paid. Other reviewers said the hotel was hard to find but we walked straight there jst look on the hotels website mapand it really is easy to find. I thouroughly recommend venice as a trip and particularly the hotel lisbona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: abcook
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for valentines week ,The hotel was in a great location just 2mins from St Marks square! Staff very welcoming and friendly.The rooms are very small but sufficient as who wants to spend time in their room whilst in Venice!! Also the less mobile may struggle as steep stairs with no lift! Good selection for breakfast, Overall a fantastic place to stay at a good price as this hotel really is in the centre of all the action!Would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojo73
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel in a truly fantastic location. My friend and I stayed for 3 nights in January - a great time to see Venice as there are hardly any tourists. It was so close to St Mark's Piazza and right next to the San Moise church so you can't miss it. We had a twin room on the top (3rd) floor which was tiny but spotlessly clean as was the bathroom which had a hot, powerful shower and bath. The twin beds were really narrow - I fell out of bed on the first night! - and the stairs up to the top floor were a bit knackering but it was worth it as it was such a charming hotel in a perfect location. The continental breakfast was good - fresh rolls and croissants, cheese, meat, jam, cereals. I would definitely stay again and reccommend this hotel to anyone. There's a really good pizzeria (run by a chinese family) close by if you are on a budget and the American bar set behind a bookshop is good (both on the street leading to St Mark's). There's also a range of decent restaurants on the other side of St Mark's square on the road next to the American Cafe. Word of warning - if you fancy going to the famous Harry's Bar for a bellini you will need to re-mortgage your house to pay for it! A complete rip off and the decor is nothing special. We only used the vapporetto once - Venice is really easy to walk around if you have a good map and it's the best way to see it - so don't bother with the 3 day pass for the water buses.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Break!!”
Reviews.Author: CityChick-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Lisbona to celebrate our First Wedding Anniversary. The Hotel was lovely, very friendly and helpful staff, good standard of continental breakfast, and the room was very clean, although a little small, but we were in Venice to see the city not the room. The bathroom was very clean, and the shower was great, powerful and nice and hot. The hotel is in an excellent location, not far from St Mark's Square. Most days we used to walk off and get lost because to get back to the hotel you only had to follow the signs for San Marco. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SudiS
Reviews.Content: After a hectic two weeks of business in London my wife and I decided to get some R&R in Venice before heading back to New York. The location is unbelievable. Just two minutes from Piazza San Marco. When you step into the lobby you feel like you are in someone's living room, not in a hotel. The front desk (a Sri Lankan speaking fluent Italian...go figure) was great for everything including booking a show we wanted to see. The hotel has no elevators and if you live on the highest floor it can be a bit of a pain after long day in the sun outside. But once you walk into the room you feel once again like a guest of some royal in olden times. The draperies and the fixtures are lovely. The bathroom on the other hand is all modern and has great fixtures. Avoid the summer in Venice if you can. 200 summer was hot as hell and teeming with tourists. I can imagine the city in the winter being quiet and mysterious.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best location in Venice?”
Reviews.Author: danzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided an excellent base for our 3 night stay in Venice. Using the directions from earlier reviews it is easy to find. We took backpacks to avoid having to drag cases on and off boats and through the crowds. Most (if not all) of the rooms overlook a small canal so you can't forget you are in Venice! It is fairly noisy during the day because of the gondola stop below but we loved watching the canal from the window. It was quiet enough at night to sleep. The room was very small (I had to get in the wardrobe to take a picture of the room!) but after a couple of hours we got used to it and actually found it quite cosy. The bathroom was quite large in comparison. Both the bedroom and bathroom were very clean. Found the beds quite comfy, perhaps not as luxurious as you'd find in a 5 star hotel but we weren't paying 5 star prices! Buffet breakfast was included with the deal we got and there was plenty of choice each morning and everything was very fresh. Staff on reception were always very friendly. The hotel felt very safe. The location couldn't have been better. We walked or got the water bus everywhere. The water bus pass was about 25 Euros for a 3 day ticket. Definately worth the money if you intend to see all the sights. Getting around on the boat was a great experience. We went in August and the weather wasn't too hot and it wasn't at all smelly. People had warned us it would be. Perhaps we were just lucky with the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianManley.
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, paid 200Euro's for a canal view room, 9/15-9/17. Was very nice view, great feel for Venice as you can see the gondola's, room is small though, bathroom was larger than expected, it was clean and worth the price for Vencie. The location is the BEST, right in the middle of everything, nice 2 star hotel, no internet service, the front desk was very helpful and nice, they offered a 8% discount if paid in cash (which we did), may be difficult to find at first, follow other directions from reveiws. Email me with any questions brianmanley@verizon.net

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not all good”
Reviews.Author: spartac
Reviews.Content: I booked a cruise in the greek Isles that was departing from Venice and decided to stay here an extra night. Hotel Lisbona had good reviews so I decided to go with it. Turned out it was an OKAY experience but definitly not a 4.5 star experience as shown here. PROs - Great location - Nice little hotel and nice staff - Great breakfest - Nice bathroom CONs: - Can be VERY noisy. I selected a canal view on the second floor (and peyed 140E). The view is nice, it was just net to Gondolas' stop. "Solo Mio" might be romantic but at 3 AM I want to sleep! - The beds were really uncomfortable. Usually I overlook this detail and adapt to different bed type but this one felt like we were sleeping on a piece of wood with springs. If I were to return I would select another hotel. And don't worry about the location, in Venise everything is quite close and it is such a pleasure to walk there anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location”
Reviews.Author: nho02
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, fantastic loaction at a resonable price. Rooms are very, very small depending on which room you are allocated but once again i have to say the loaction is excellent for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel + Perfect Location + Great Staff = Happy Travelers!”
Reviews.Author: lsl327
Reviews.Content: I am a little late getting around to writing my review of this lovely little hotel, but I canâ€™t resist. First the consâ€¦there are few! The bed in our room was hard! If you like a firm bed, then stay in this hotel. A tip, we used the extra blankets and the top coverlet under our sheets for a little extra padding. My husband had more trouble with it than I did. You are so tired from a day of walking that I didnâ€™t even notice so much. Ok, that is it for cons. My favorite thing was the windows in our room. First of all visiting Venice you must absorb the sounds. In the streets you hear people taking, shoes clicking along, music and no motor cars! From our window I enjoyed the gondolas slow rhythm in the water. It is a soothing sound that echoes between the buildings on a quite morning. A sound that I can hear quite well as I write this review. We were on the top floor in the corner room and had lovely views from our shuttered windows. The rooms are spotless. The bathrooms are spotless. The shower is adequate and has lots of hot water. Tip, donâ€™t let you hose get a crimp in it, for some reason you only get cold water then. The sheets are spotless and softer than I expected. The heater worked well, it was cold when we were there so I am canâ€™t speak for the cooling. The keys are enormous, we left ours at the desk every morning on our way out and we always got it on our way in. There is always someone at the desk. Smiling and enquiring about your dayâ€™s plans or your adventures. We were out quite late at times and there was always someone at the desk. Breakfast is on time and simple but good. They always had some meats, breads, yogurts, cereals, and breakfast type beverages. Remember, this not America, you donâ€™t bacon and eggs for free! Go to McDonalds if you need an American fix. Our room was ok quite, not silent but good enough for us. We stayed five nights and were very pleased. We have stayed in a few other places in Venice and the hotel Lisbona is good for the price. The location canâ€™t be beat for major tourist sites. But please get off the beaten path, get lost your on an island you canâ€™t get far! I hope you find as much magic as we do when you visit Venice. If you would like a link to our personal website about our trip please email me lsl327@yahoo.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: GroverSmiths
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lisbona for four nights over Easter 2006. The hotel is situated on the Canal San Moise just off the Campo San Moise. Its easy to find and the nearest vaporetto stop is no more than 5 minutes away at Vallaresso/San Marco. The hotel is in a great location for exploring Venice and the outer islands. Our room (no11) had everything we needed, plus a great little balcony for watching the gondoliers and water taxis go by on the canal below. The breakfast was a good continental buffet (hot croissants, rolls, cereals etc) - only 5 tables but it didnt cause any problems to us and the staff are very helpful. We had a really great time there and would definitely return. If you are there for three days - its really worth getting the three day transport ticket - easy for hopping off along the Grand Canal and covers you to get to Lido, Murano and Burano/Torcello. The transport is really efficient and runs on time. The Alilaguna from the airport takes about 70 mins but at 11 euros per person - its a good deal and beats the water taxis at 100 euro a throw which are not worth it unless there are 6 or more of you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night break in Venice with my 13 year old daughter. The hotel is in great location, 5 minute walk from St Marks Square, next door to all the designer shops, Prada, Versace etc, so take lots of money, its hard to just walk on by!! The hotel was very clean, the rooms are slightly small, but they have all you need, we were in room 11 on the first floor overlooking a small canal with a gondolar stop, we had a small balcony and lovely shutters, the room has a mini bar (prices very reasonable) tv (poor reception) a small walk in wardrobe with a free safe, the bathroom was clean and modern with hairdryer. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast area was small, but if you faced the window you could see a gondolier going passed as you are eating breakfast. There was a good choice of breakfast(continental) and great coffee. Rooms was cleaned each day. Had a fantastic time in Venice, hotel was great and the city fabulous everything i thought it would be and more! Very expensive though, so take lots of money and enjoy this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed !”
Reviews.Author: rjhall
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel - right in the heart of Venice. Easy to find - from Valaresso waterbus stop take road past Harrys Bar, turn left at top - go over bridge and its immediately on the left. We had a small double room with two windows with small balcony overlooking a canal. Excellent breakfasts - great restaurant recommendations. Very clean. 80 euros a night - a bargain !

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lisbona for 2 nights in mid November. We knew we were only going to be in Venice for a short stay & wanted somewhere fairly cheap, clean & safe. I believe we got what we were looking for from this hotel. The room is small, but Iâ€™ve found that to be the case everywhere Iâ€™ve stayed in Europe though Iâ€™ve never stayed in a really expensive hotel. When youâ€™re basically only in the room to sleep, I donâ€™t think it needs to be very big. Our room (23) overlooked the canal/gondola stop, which was nice. The hotel staff was friendly, the bathroom clean, the price was right & the breakfast the best of what we had during our stay in Italy. Thanks to those on this website who wrote out the directions to the hotel. With the hotel entrance being kind of tucked away, they were helpful!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: mly
Reviews.Content: We stayed from sept. 29-october 09 in room 22, a standard room. Yes it was small, but we weren't in it very much. This is a three-star, not a luxury hotel, but it's clean, comfortable and, as a bonus, our room overlooked a side canal. Other standard rooms didn't have a balcony but ours did, albeit small. Every morning I started the day by watching the canal traffic right below. Hotel staff was enormously helpful. We paid 170E a night, not terrible in expensive Venice. One caveat: the breakfast area is small, only 5 tables; no problem if you arrive at 8 when service starts, but come later, and there can be a wait. From the San Marco stop, it's a snap to reach: exit the ferry and turn left. Go over the bridge and continue until you come to Harry's bar (on your right). Turn right and keep walking (this is a street that's lined with shops). At the end, make a left and go over the San Moise bridge. Once on the other side, turn left and just go straight. Caution: the arch has Violin d'Oro written on it but just keep going under the arch. The Lisbona is right there.

Reviews.Title: “If you can find it - a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCM81
Reviews.Content: In September 2005, we spent two nights at the Lisbona which is located in the heart of Venice. It is not an easy hotel to find as it is located behind another hotel off a small square near the bridge where the gondolas are moored. Just make sure that you take note of the building numbers and the task of locating this hotel becomes easier. Our room on the first floor overlooked the canal but when the windows were shut you could not hear a sound. The room was small and the bathroom was tiny. There was no lift (elevator) and the stairs are rather steep. The dining room for breakfast was also very small which is fine as long as all the guests do not descend for breakfast at the same time. The hotel is in a great location and although our room was very small, we would recommend the hotel due to the location which is five minutes walk from Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for only 3 nights. It was clean and ok but for 130.00 Euros, I would also expect this. Fortunately, we had a canal view and it was quite amazing hearing the Gondoliers sang! We also had to wait for breakfast one time but it was not really a big deal (wait approx. 10 minutes). We found the big plus was the location of the hotel. It is really very close to St. Marks square. We would recommend this hotel but again, it was not a bargain but what is a bargain in venice...

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, highly recommend hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I travelled to Venice on the 26th August 05. We took the No. 5 bus service from Marco Polo to Piazzale Roma (2 euros)and then the Vaparetto Water bus No. 82 route down to the San Marco stop (72 hour ticket for 22 euros). The hotel is easy to find (thanks to previous Tripadvisor reviews for the tip!). From the Vaparetto stop head left and then turn right into a long narrow street full of designer shops, take a left at the end of the street and keep going until you reach a bridge, cross the bridge and turn immediately left - you will see the entrance for the Lisbona under the archway. We arrived at midday but could not check in until 2pm. The hotel kept our luggage so we could have a stroll around. The Lisbona is in a great position, just two mins walk from St Marks Square and 15-20 walk (if you don't get lost!) from the Rialto bridge. We were on the top floor (3rd) which was great for the view, but tiring on the legs as there is no lift! I think 9 of the 12 rooms have a canal view, but not sure. Rooms are very clean, ok size for the few days we were there. Bed very comfy. Bathroom is small but spotlessly clean. Reception staff are friendly. Breakfast (served 8-10am) is delicious - crossiants, rolls, ham, cheese, yoghurts, fruit etc. Tiny breakfast room - only 5 tables, but then there are only 12 rooms. We never had to wait for a table. Cannot comment on value for money as I work for a travel agency and my holiday was discounted, but hotel could not be faulted. I would recommend the Lisbona to anyone wanting a peaceful, comfortable hotel. Check out at 11am, again hotel offered to hold our luggage. TIP - Bring plenty of euros as Venice is EXPENSIVE! (eg Â£8.00 for a coke and a pint of beer). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2112
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel located in the heart of venice. We booked this hotel at a little hotel stand near the parking garage after returning from a Costa Cruise. The room was 130 euros for a canal view room. Super deal for venice. Room had a very nice bed and was clean and quite. Breakfest is included..cereals, breads, juice,coffee, cheese, ect. Staff was very helpful and offered suggestions for sights and food. This hotel is located very close to everything. We stayed for 3 nights and really enjoyed the view of the canal and the beauty of this one of a kind city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Better Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days two nights at the beginning of May. Paid $200 USD per night. The hotel is at a fantastic location, 2-minute walk from the Vallaresso stop on the water taxi (#82 or 1) and again a 2-minute walk from St. Mark's Square. Hotel has no elevator. English-speaking staff was helpful. Breakfast consisted of meats, cheeses and cereals. The room was great, we had a corner room, considered a double. Had a king-sized bed. The room was spacious and nicely decorated. The bathroom was beautiful. AC was not yet functioning (concierge said it was a city-wide mandate) and so we slept with the windows open. Very comfortable temperature-wise but somewhat noisy (right next to a canal) and a few mosquitoes tormented us. Overall, great hotel. Would recommend to anyone and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for our family of 6”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked another Venice hotel 4 months in advance of our trip only to receive a cancellation email 5 days prior to our arrival in Venice. As part of the cancellation notice, they re-assigned us to Hotel Lisbona. What a gem! I can't speak for our original hotel, but we felt very fortunate that Lisbona would take on our large family. We had two connected rooms for our children (ages 16, 14, 12 and 10) and our room was right next to theirs. We were in a quiet corner of the hotel with tons of privacy! Lots of stairs and no lift, but that's just part of being in Europe. Perfect location just steps from Piazza San Marco. We went into our stay skeptical and were pleasantly surprised!

Reviews.Title: “Snow in Venice - it was gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: KatherineNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2005 and got snow - so beautiful! The hotel room was tiny and there is no lift, but we were completely happy with it. Clean, helpful staff, FABULOUS breakfasts and the location was great, although it is hard to find, but that's because of how Venice (doesn't!) number the streets. We stayed there because of the reviews on this site and would thoroughly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a three-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: girlietraveller
Reviews.Content: 3 of us had a 2 night stay. Warm and clean hotel, no probs with bed, bath, shower or TVwhich were in good condition. We had 1 superior double room which was not that small compared to 3 star hotels in the UK and Europe and 1 single room which had two beds and was a bit of a squeeze. However, going off season the price was very reasonable. Staff were helpful and they spoke english. Breakfast room was small and we had to wait a few minutes for a table on one morning but a good all you can eat continental buffet. Good location for getting to all parts of Venice by foot, 2 minutes to St Marks, 5 minutes to Rialto, 5 minutes to Acaedemia and easy to pop back in the middle of the day. No problem finding it with the directions from the reviews on this site. Overall we would recommend this hotel and would return.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Lisbona
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 2153, 30124 Venice, Italy
